chunks.original_text: 顺行、倒行、反行，三道都毕，乃又举两足，俱上阳明星，以右手拊心，以左手指玄冥星，闭气三息，叩齿三七，咽液三九，名曰据斗。 微祝曰： 阳明紫炁，太素玄辰，金阙黄房，中有大神，左拊上皇，右把高真，龙衔翠衣，飞锦虎文，腰带玉符，首戴莲冠，出无入虚，金真玉光，灵尊巍峨，号曰阳明，足蹑朱烟，口咏洞章，赐某隐书，见教步纲，周行三复，据斗自忘，使某飞仙，超虚浮空，名书上清，乘玄驾龙，意有所之，愿乐皆从，三尊合德，魂魄内通，致给神官，玉女玉童，有恶某者，形以电风，奸谋断舌，裔之十方。 祝毕，存心中忽然，忘身良久而下。 据斗之道既毕，乃又两足俱上阴精星，以左手拊心，以右手指真人星，闭炁三息，叩齿三通，咽液三过，名曰攀魁入太微。 微咒曰： 阴精玄素，华阙生门，中有玉帝，北极至尊，凤绣华领，龙翠碧裙，腰虎佩铃，扶芝丹冠，号曰阴精，太上之君，授某隐书，使步七元，攀魁上升，遂游灵关，外拘七魄，内制三魂，魄炼俗累，魂宝胎神，魂魄守身，与之俱仙，飞行上清，还炁婴颜，所向如心，万欲无难，有恶某者，形死三官，威摄六天，役使群神。 攀魁之道既毕，乃又两足俱上弼星，并足向真人星，四拜毕，跪闭炁四息，叩齿四通，咽液四过，名曰接真。 当正心，从魁中入登弼星上，勿横度纲也。 跪，微祝曰： 太极九精，上元明真，正机把衡，吐纳紫烟，金光玉映，威照十天，摄御三光，调阳和阴，理元赋炁，改易故新，上治中宿，玄关之玄，金室玉户，北掖四便，出驾八景，浮游太元，龙锦凤衣，虎翠飞裙，绛旌绿帔，紫羽七缘，腰带神符，首戴扶冠，上栖九虚，下翔天渊，自号玉皇，九天极真，哀某好道，授某隐篇，躬登弼魁，朝拜灵君，乞愿丹书，为生之先，得治三天，飞行八玄，五脏自生，上品飞仙，得翼玉帝，后圣之臣，位高大夫，乘云飞轮，所愿皆合，众邪莫干，有恶我者，暴形破门。 接真之道既毕，乃又两足俱上玄冥星，以右手拊心，左手指丹元星，闭炁三息，叩齿三七通，咽液三过，名曰北斗。 微祝曰： 洞天神光，回隐玄冥，炁盈太虚，去来无形，隐天藏地，周灌无生，忽登天纲，上步紫庭，北视雷房，南顾电城，眩惑万变，非复故形，恍惚流景，捅手立成，欲求藏身，得我姓名，虚无傲兀，九变玄冥，坐起六甲，谒署六丁，赐某隐书，步斗行星，仰见上皇，披丹巾青，手把灵光，腰带玉铃，上乞飞仙，与天俱生，名书太微，浮行上清，下乞变化，藏景录形，万事如愿，所摧皆平，有恶我者，戮以神兵。 太极真经金根上文曰：子登玄冥，步斗隐形，子欲变化，当得我名，回天动地，万物立成。 步玄冥时，及欲隐时，当心存此名字。 步斗之道既毕，乃又两足俱上丹元星，以左手拊心，以右手指北极星，闭炁三息，叩齿三通，咽液三过，名曰蹑纪。 微祝曰： 太上九台，丹元玄纪，外管北枢，内正天理，金阙映外，玉庭耀裹，中有至尊，号曰赤子，治在丹元，绛房之中，翠云绣华，龙帔虎裳，右执皇箓，左把魁纲，足蹑景云，首巾紫冠，右佩流铃，左带玉铛，赐某隐书，蹑纪游行，上乞飞仙，乘玄驾龙，书名丹台，太极玉堂，所向所求，福禄来迎，有恶某者，愿为灭亡，给侍神官，玉女玉童。
chunks.translated_text:
Proceeding in sequence, reversing, and retracing—once the Three Paths are complete, raise both feet together onto the Yang Bright Star. With the right hand pressed to the heart and the left hand pointing to the Dark Obscurity Star, hold the breath for three cycles, knock the teeth three times seven, and swallow saliva three times nine. This is called "Grasping the Dipper."

Softly intone the incantation:
*"Purple qi of Yang Bright, dark essence of Grand Simplicity,
Golden Watchtower, Yellow Chamber—within dwells the Great Spirit.
Left hand grasps the Supreme August One; right hand holds the Lofty Perfected.
Dragon clasps emerald robes; flying brocade bears tiger patterns.
Jade talismans gird the waist; lotus crowns adorn the head.
Exiting into the Void, entering the Nonexistent—golden perfection, jade radiance.
The numinous sovereign, majestic and towering, is named Yang Bright.
Feet tread crimson mist; mouth chants the Cavernous Chapters.
Grant me the Hidden Scriptures, teach me the stepping of the Nets.
Circling thrice, grasping the Dipper, I forget myself.
Let me become a flying immortal, soaring beyond the Void.
Inscribe my name in the Upper Clarity; ride the dark dragon’s chariot.
Wherever my intent turns, all wishes follow.
The Three Venerables unite their power; soul and spirit commune within.
Dispatch the divine officials, jade maidens, and jade lads.
Those who harbor evil against me—
let their forms be struck by lightning and wind,
their treacherous schemes severed at the tongue,
banished to the Ten Directions."*

The incantation complete, focus the mind until suddenly all self is forgotten—lingering long before descending.

When the "Grasping the Dipper" method is finished, raise both feet together onto the Yin Essence Star. With the left hand pressed to the heart and the right hand pointing to the Perfected Star, hold the breath for three cycles, knock the teeth three times, and swallow saliva three times. This is called "Climbing the Culmen to Enter the Grand Tenuity."

Softly recite the charm:
*"Dark essence of Yin, flowery watchtower of the Gate of Life—
within dwells the Jade Emperor, the Northern Culmen’s Most Revered.
Phoenix-embroidered collar, dragon-green jade skirts,
tiger-girded waist bells, mushroom-red crowns.
Named Yin Essence, the Supreme Lord of the Highest,
you bestow the Hidden Scriptures, teaching me to step the Seven Origins.
Climbing the Culmen, ascending to wander the Numinous Pass,
externally restraining the seven po, internally governing the three hun.
Po refined of worldly burdens; hun treasured as the womb-spirit.
Hun and po guard the body, ascending as immortals together.
Soaring through the Upper Clarity, returning qi to rejuvenate the countenance.
Wherever I turn, all desires come effortlessly.
Those who harbor evil against me—
let their forms perish before the Three Officials,
their might subduing the Six Heavens,
commanding the host of spirits."*

When the "Climbing the Culmen" method is finished, raise both feet together onto the Corrector Star, feet aligned toward the Perfected Star. Bow four times, then kneel, holding the breath for four cycles, knocking the teeth four times, and swallowing saliva four times. This is called "Receiving the Perfected."

Focus the mind, entering from the Culmen to ascend onto the Corrector Star—do not cross the Nets transversely. Kneeling, softly intone the incantation:
*"Nine essences of the Great Ultimate, luminous perfected of the Upper Origin,
grasping the balance of the primal mechanism, exhaling and inhaling purple mist.
Golden light and jade radiance, majesty illuminating the Ten Heavens,
commanding the Three Luminaries, harmonizing yang and yin.
Governing the origin, bestowing qi, transforming the old into the new.
Above, ruling the Central Mansion; the mystery within the Mysterious Pass.
Golden chambers, jade portals—four conveniences at the Northern Palace.
Exiting to ride the Eight Effulgences, floating through the Grand Origin.
Dragon-brocade, phoenix robes; tiger-green flying skirts.
Crimson banners, green stoles; purple feathers with seven borders.
Girded with divine talismans; crowned with supporting coronets.
Above, perching in the Nine Voids; below, soaring through celestial abysses.
Self-styled Jade Emperor, Ultimate Perfected of the Nine Heavens.
Pitying my devotion to the Dao, you bestow the Hidden Chapters.
I ascend the Corrector and Culmen, paying homage to the Numinous Lord.
Beseeching the cinnabar scriptures, the forerunner of life.
Let me govern the Three Heavens, soar through the Eight Mysteries.
The five viscera self-generated, attaining the highest rank of flying immortals.
Becoming the Jade Emperor’s winged attendant, minister to the Later Sages.
Ranked as Grand Master, riding clouds and flying wheels.
All wishes fulfilled; no demon dares approach.
Those who harbor evil against me—
let their forms be exposed, their gates shattered."*

When the "Receiving the Perfected" method is finished, raise both feet together onto the Dark Obscurity Star. With the right hand pressed to the heart and the left hand pointing to the Cinnabar Origin Star, hold the breath for three cycles, knock the teeth three times seven, and swallow saliva three times. This is called "The Northern Dipper."

Softly intone the incantation:
*"Divine radiance of the Cavernous Heavens, concealed within Dark Obscurity,
qi filling the Grand Void, coming and going without form.
Hidden in heaven, concealed in earth, pervading the unborn.
Suddenly ascending the Celestial Nets, stepping the Purple Court.
Gazing north to the Thunder Chambers, south to the Lightning Cities.
Dazzling transformations—no longer the former form.
Vast and indistinct, flowing light—with a touch, instantly achieved.
Seeking to conceal oneself—know my name.
Void and proud, ninefold Dark Obscurity.
Sitting and rising with the Six Jia, visiting and appointing the Six Ding.
Grant me the Hidden Scriptures, stepping the Dipper and walking the stars.
Looking up to the Supreme August One—
robed in cinnabar and azure, holding numinous radiance,
girded with jade bells.
Above, beseeching to become a flying immortal, born together with heaven.
Inscribe my name in the Grand Tenuity, floating through the Upper Clarity.
Below, beseeching transformations, concealing light and recording form.
All affairs as wished; all obstacles leveled.
Those who harbor evil against me—
let them be slain by divine soldiers."*

The *Golden Root Text of the Great Ultimate Perfection* states:
*"When you ascend Dark Obscurity and step the Dipper to conceal your form,
if you wish to transform, know my name.
Revolving heaven and moving earth, all things instantly achieved."*

When stepping Dark Obscurity or desiring concealment, focus the mind on this name.

When the "Stepping the Dipper" method is finished, raise both feet together onto the Cinnabar Origin Star. With the left hand pressed to the heart and the right hand pointing to the Northern Culmen Star, hold the breath for three cycles, knock the teeth three times, and swallow saliva three times. This is called "Treading the Records."

Softly intone the incantation:
*"Nine terraces of the Supreme, dark records of the Cinnabar Origin—
externally governing the Northern Pivot, internally rectifying celestial principles.
Golden Watchtowers gleaming without; jade courts shining within.
Within dwells the Most Revered, named the Crimson Child,
ruling in the Cinnabar Origin, the Crimson Chamber’s midst.
Emerald clouds, embroidered flowers; dragon stoles, tiger robes.
Right hand holds the August Register; left hand grasps the Culmen’s Nets.
Feet tread luminous clouds; head wrapped in purple coronets.
Right side bears flowing bells; left side girded with jade chimes.
Grant me the Hidden Scriptures, treading the Records in wandering.
Above, beseeching to become a flying immortal, riding the dark dragon’s chariot.
Inscribe my name on the Cinnabar Terrace, the Jade Hall of the Great Ultimate.
Wherever I turn, wherever I seek—blessings and emoluments come forth.
Those who harbor evil against me—
let them perish, attended by divine officials, jade maidens, and jade lads."*

chunks.original_text: 蹑纪之道既毕，乃又两足俱上北极星，以右手拊心，以左手指天关星，闭炁三息，叩齿三通，咽液三过，名曰步纲。 微祝曰： 玄上太微，北极紫盖，下有太真，游翔九外，翠华飞裙，金铃青带，腰佩玉光，玄云奄蔼，赐某隐书，上行七炁，登清戏烟，真人合会，乞丐飞仙，书名丹室，所向如愿，无灾无害，有恶我者，令彼伤败。 步纲之道既毕，乃又两足俱上天关星，以右手拊心，以左手指天关，闭炁三息，叩齿三通，咽液三过，名曰乘龙。 微祝曰： 太上七极，紫微绝辰，宝玄金房，外有玉门，周运九宫，调和天关，中有尊神，号曰紫皇，授某隐书，携某乘龙，上游九天，下飞地元，景云丹舆，玄华翠裳，腰佩龙策，头巾虎文，包生万物，教训飞仙，脱某死名，天地长存，乘龙步斗，所向受恩，有恶我者，风刀火然。 乘龙之道既毕，乃又两足俱上辅星，闭炁一息，叩齿三通，咽液一过，名曰游行三命，旋步天英也。 微祝曰： 太极辅星，精在紫关养在育命，宝守神魂，金房再开，奉见辅君，赐某隐书，使某游旋，列名圣皇，飞仙九天，巾金佩真，出入洞门 。 游行三命既毕，乃回行诣弼星，两足俱上，闭炁一息，叩齿三通，咽液一过，名曰徘徊三阳，出入三生，微祝曰： 太虚泥丸，紫宫天尊，玄空真纽，为帝之先，在道玉皇，在身泥丸，平感剡生，炁贯霄元，精入明堂，强胎益魂，朱山再开，奉近灵元，左采日华，又掇月根，流火万丈，金罗碧裙，腰带天骨，首戴华冠，赐某隐书，得行天关，乞愿飞仙，役使万神，万向皆会，福德如山。 行事时皆向北，执书而为之也。 亦可按文视星，不必暗诵而作也。 后圣君受太上步纲隐书，以付方诸青童君，青童君以传王君，使密授骨命玉籍有仙名者，按而行之。 其无仙录录字之人，徒见而不求，有而不行也。 非不欲行，神遏之上。 按《四极明科》，太上隐书，听七百岁中传三人，过此不得复出。 授书初时，皆先试彼人，而后传耳。 试观非一条例，唯取令其猜恚，及可否与夺之事也。 是以古之真人，以察其心而定其志，看其行而观其事矣。 子於传授之际，微其言哉。

Once the treading of the Records is complete, then place both feet upon the North Star. With the right hand pressed to the heart and the left hand pointing to the Celestial Pivot star, hold the qi for three breaths, knock the teeth three times, and swallow the saliva three times—this is called "Stepping the Nets."

A whispered prayer follows:
"Above in the Great Subtlety, the Purple Canopy of the North Star,
below dwells the Supreme Perfected, soaring beyond the Nine Exteriors.
Emerald skirts take flight; golden bells and azure sashes,
a waist girded with jade radiance, dark clouds swirling thick.
Grant me the Hidden Scriptures, ascending the Seven Qi,
mounting the clear mists in play, meeting with the Perfected.
I beseech to become a flying immortal, inscribing my name in the Cinnabar Chamber.
Wherever I turn, may my wishes be fulfilled—
no calamity, no harm.
Those who harbor evil against me—
let them suffer defeat."

Once the Stepping of the Nets is complete, then place both feet upon the Celestial Pivot star. With the right hand pressed to the heart and the left hand pointing to the Celestial Pivot, hold the qi for three breaths, knock the teeth three times, and swallow the saliva three times—this is called "Riding the Dragon."

A whispered prayer follows:
"Supreme Seven Poles, Purple Tenuity’s farthest star,
Precious Mystery’s Golden Chamber, beyond lies the Jade Gate.
Revolving through the Nine Palaces, harmonizing the Celestial Pivot,
within dwells the Revered Divinity, named the Purple Sovereign.
Bestow upon me the Hidden Scriptures, bearing me to ride the dragon,
ascending the Nine Heavens, descending to the Earth’s Origin.
Luminous clouds and cinnabar chariots, dark splendor and emerald robes,
a waist girded with the Dragon’s Whip, a head wrapped in tiger-patterned silk.
Encompassing the birth of the myriad things, instructing the flying immortals,
freeing me from the name of death, abiding with heaven and earth forever.
Riding the dragon, pacing the Dipper—
wherever I turn, may I receive favor.
Those who harbor evil against me—
let wind-blades and fire consume them."

Once Riding the Dragon is complete, then place both feet upon the Assistant Star. Hold the qi for one breath, knock the teeth three times, and swallow the saliva once—this is called "Wandering the Three Destinies," circling the Celestial Flower.

A whispered prayer follows:
"Great Ultimate’s Assistant Star, essence nurtured in the Purple Pass,
life fostered in the Chamber of Destiny, treasures guarding spirit and soul.
The Golden Chamber opens again; I am granted audience with the Assistant Lord.
Grant me the Hidden Scriptures, allowing me to wander and revolve,
inscribing my name among the Sagely Emperors.
A flying immortal of the Nine Heavens, crowned in gold and girded with the Perfected,
entering and exiting the Grotto Gate."

Once Wandering the Three Destinies is complete, then turn and proceed to the Adjuvant Star. Place both feet upon it, hold the qi for one breath, knock the teeth three times, and swallow the saliva once—this is called "Pacing the Three Yang," entering and exiting the Three Lives.

A whispered prayer follows:
"Great Void’s Mud-Pill Palace, the Purple Palace’s Heavenly Honored,
Mysterious Void’s True Axis, forerunner of the Emperor.
In the Dao, the Jade Sovereign; in the body, the Mud-Pill.
Balanced resonance quickens life; qi pierces the Empyrean’s Origin.
Essence enters the Hall of Light, strengthening the embryo and augmenting the soul.
The Vermilion Mountain opens again; I draw near the Numinous Origin.
To the left, I gather the sun’s splendor; to the right, I pluck the moon’s root.
Flowing fire ten thousand fathoms, golden gauze and azure skirts,
a waist girded with Heaven’s Bone, a head crowned with floral coronets.
Grant me the Hidden Scriptures, allowing me to traverse the Celestial Pivot.
I beseech to become a flying immortal, commanding the myriad spirits.
Wherever I turn, may all converge—
blessings and virtue like mountains."

All actions are performed facing north, holding the scriptures. One may also follow the text while observing the stars, without reciting from memory.

Later, the Sagely Lord received the Supreme’s *Stepping the Nets Hidden Scriptures* and transmitted them to the Azure Lad of the Square Cauldron. The Azure Lad passed them to Lord Wang, who secretly bestowed them upon those whose names were inscribed in the Jade Register of Bone Destinies. Those without their names in the immortal records may glimpse but not seek them, possess but not practice them. Not that they do not wish to practice—divine forces bar their ascent.

According to the *Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*, the Supreme’s Hidden Scriptures may be transmitted to only three persons within seven hundred years; beyond this, they may not be revealed again. When bestowing the scriptures, the recipient is first tested. Only after passing are they transmitted. The trials are not uniform, designed only to provoke their temper and discern their resolve through matters of granting or withholding. Thus did the Perfected of old examine their hearts to determine their will, observing their conduct to assess their deeds.

Be subtle in speech during transmission.

chunks.original_text: 黄上先生受黄累小童步三纲之法，行其要诀，遂飞迅景云，北游於上清之宫，出入生门，呼吸虚无。 黄帝受襄城小童步六纪之法，行其要诀，遂铸鼎荆山，隐变乔陵，驾龙玄圃，乘云阆风。 广成子受东海中元小童步六害之法，行其要诀，遂乘三素之云，到无极之野，驾华凤八龙，入无穷之门，倒行太虚，位为玉皇。 龚仲阳受嵩高小童步六绝之法，行其要诀，逐登朱光丹陵，乘玄上造，御十飞蝉，游行南冥，绛云为盖，以入五城。 夫四小童，并天真之师也。 所受隐书施行，俱一事耳。 三纲、六纪、六害、六绝，异其名耳。 春步七星，名曰步三纲。 夏步七星，名曰蹑六纪。 秋步七星，名曰行六害。 冬步七星，名曰登六绝。 按而密行，浮游上清。 王君曰：吾经周时也，涉战国之间，游强秦之中，出大汉之世，履地源，游九宫，见诸仙人，问诸真官，始求此道，无不步天元，行纪纲者，得其道，速成而不难也。 是以被衣步纲，七精下游； 啮缺步纲，上登天堂； 王倪步纲，乘云十天； 黄帝步纲，精为轩辕； 许由步纲，凤凰群翔：巢父步纲，上朝天皇； 支离步纲，栖集阆风； 华封步纲，体生玄云； 子州步纲，翠龙虎服； 善卷步纲，乘蹻龙烛； 石户步纲，飞行瀛州； 北人步纲，玉女来游； 蒱衣步纲，遂入北斗； 安公步纲，赤龙见负； 桓成步纲，遂见文始，得友西归，半车童子； 二女步纲，俱澣白水，乃见金母，栖身东陛； 卞随步纲，驾龙泰清； 务光步纲，身超紫庭； 马皇步纲，龙云俱至； 彭祖步纲，乃之流沙； 老聃步纲，称曰圣师，关令受教，俱会云台； 郊间步纲，乘龙奔辰，放钓弃纶，永为上真； 大项步纲，色反婴儿； 秦始步纲，神龙吐符； 涓子步纲，河出灵鱼，服挹玉液，遂升玄洲； 萧史步纲，隐逸秦楼，弄玉受教，俱到青丘； 接舆步纲，夫妻俱仙，得治峨媚，封掌山川； 伯昏步纲，列为水灵； 庚桑步纲，游行八冥。 皆须此术，要道乃成。 故粗撰其人，以告於子。 或先勤而后息，历试观而不过者，亦皆成地仙，及得尸解之身，或成地下主者，当复数千百人也。 不能一二记其姓名矣。 诸尸解地下主者，按四极真科，一百四十年乃得补仙官，复一千三百年，乃得补真官，於是始得飞华盖，乘群龙，登太极，游九宫也。 谨按法度，奉而行之，无不得仙，精心勤诚，用一十四年耳。 於是乃七星之精，下化成神人，并乘流铃八景，丹玄班云，俱来诣於子，拜子仙官，授子真符，道成皆登上清，升太微宫。 勉之勤之，所向必感，亦何为怠情，而为尸解太阴地下主者，方复一百四十年，然后得阶乎。 吾昔亦由精勤，而致此也。 步纲之日，一月七日为之也。 月一日、五日、九日、十五日、二十日、二十五日、二十九日。 若夜步则用夜半，若白日则用日中，若在无人处，日中止庭乃吉，要不欲令俗人见。 俗人见则天精不降。 斗建正，月建寅，暗暮天关临寅，平旦临申，日中临亥，但按月斗建，推计昼夜，常知所在，以图象随之。 若见凶鬼恶人，但存斗星以指之，闭炁，心祝曰： 吾是天目，与天相逐，睛若雷电，明耀八域，彻知表裹，无物不服。 如此则奸凶万鬼，祸恶众非，莫来犯子。 甲子日、八节日，皆步纲得仙，而致七星诣子。

The Yellow Supreme Master received from the Yellow Youth the method of *Stepping the Three Principles*, practiced its essential secrets, and swiftly ascended upon luminous clouds, journeying north to the Palace of Supreme Clarity. He entered and exited the Gate of Life, inhaling and exhaling the Void.

The Yellow Emperor received from the Xiangcheng Youth the method of *Stepping the Six Records*, practiced its essential secrets, and cast a tripod at Mount Jing, concealing his transformation at Qiaoling. He rode a dragon to the Dark Garden, mounting clouds to ascend the Towering Wind.

Guangchengzi received from the Central Prime Youth of the Eastern Sea the method of *Stepping the Six Harms*, practiced its essential secrets, and rode the Tri-Subtle Clouds to the Boundless Wilderness. He harnessed eight flowery phoenixes and dragons, entered the Gate of Infinity, and traversed backward through the Great Void, attaining the rank of Jade Emperor.

Gong Zhongyang received from the Songgao Youth the method of *Stepping the Six Severances*, practiced its essential secrets, and ascended the Vermilion Radiance of the Cinnabar Mound. He rode the Dark Prime Chariot, drove ten flying cicadas, and roamed the Southern Darkness, with crimson clouds as his canopy, entering the Five Cities.

These four youths were all teachers of celestial perfection. The hidden scriptures they received and practiced were one and the same—only their names differed: *Three Principles*, *Six Records*, *Six Harms*, and *Six Severances*.

In spring, stepping the Seven Stars is called *Stepping the Three Principles*.
In summer, stepping the Seven Stars is called *Treading the Six Records*.
In autumn, stepping the Seven Stars is called *Walking the Six Harms*.
In winter, stepping the Seven Stars is called *Ascending the Six Severances*.
Practicing these in secret, one floats and wanders in Supreme Clarity.

Master Wang said: "In my time, I traversed the Zhou era, passed through the Warring States, wandered the strong Qin, and emerged in the great Han. I trod the earth’s sources, roamed the Nine Palaces, met various immortals, and questioned the perfected officials. When I first sought this Dao, all who stepped the Celestial Origin and practiced the Records and Principles attained the Way swiftly and without difficulty.

Thus:
- Bei Yi stepped the Principles, and the Seven Essences descended to roam below.
- Nie Que stepped the Principles and ascended to the Heavenly Hall.
- Wang Ni stepped the Principles and rode clouds to the Ten Heavens.
- The Yellow Emperor stepped the Principles, and his essence became the Xuanyuan.
- Xu You stepped the Principles, and phoenixes flocked around him.
- Chaofu stepped the Principles and ascended to attend the Heavenly Emperor.
- Zhili stepped the Principles and dwelled in the Towering Wind.
- Hua Feng stepped the Principles, and his body generated dark clouds.
- Zizhou stepped the Principles and wore robes of green dragon and tiger.
- Shanjuan stepped the Principles and rode a swift dragon torch.
- Shihu stepped the Principles and flew to Yingzhou.
- The Northern Man stepped the Principles, and jade maidens came to roam with him.
- Pu Yi stepped the Principles and entered the Northern Dipper.
- Master An stepped the Principles, and a red dragon bore him.
- Huan Cheng stepped the Principles, met Wen Shi, gained a companion, and returned west with the Half-Chariot Youth.
- The Two Women stepped the Principles, washed in white waters, met the Metal Mother, and dwelled on the Eastern Steps.
- Bian Sui stepped the Principles and rode a dragon to the Grand Clarity.
- Wu Guang stepped the Principles and transcended to the Purple Court.
- Ma Huang stepped the Principles, and dragons and clouds arrived together.
- Peng Zu stepped the Principles and journeyed to the Flowing Sands.
- Lao Dan stepped the Principles, was hailed as the Sage Master, and the Pass Keeper received his teachings; together they ascended the Cloud Terrace.
- Jiaojian stepped the Principles, rode a dragon to chase the stars, cast aside his fishing rod, and forever became an Upper Perfected.
- Da Xiang stepped the Principles, and his complexion reverted to that of an infant.
- The First Qin Emperor stepped the Principles, and a divine dragon spat forth a talisman.
- Juanzi stepped the Principles, and the river yielded a spirit fish. He drank the Jade Liquid and ascended to the Dark Continent.
- Xiao Shi stepped the Principles, recluded in the Qin Tower. Nongyu received his teachings, and together they reached the Green Mound.
- Jieyu stepped the Principles, and husband and wife both became immortals. He governed Mount Emei and was enfeoffed over mountains and rivers.
- Bohun stepped the Principles and was ranked among the Water Spirits.
- Geng Sang stepped the Principles and roamed the Eight Darknesses.

All required this art for the essential Dao to be accomplished. Thus, I roughly record these figures to inform you. Some toiled first and later rested; those who underwent trials and did not falter also became earthbound immortals, attained the body of corpse liberation, or became lords of the underworld—numbering in the thousands. chunks.original_text: 诸步纲者，勿以冬甲子日夕眠卧，七星之光掩人眼精。 步纲脱死名上玉箓法，用正月三日、二月十一日、三月十九日、四月八日、五月五日、六月九日、七月七日、八月四日、九月九日、十月五日、十一月八日、十二月十二日。 用此日步纲，方诸宫那仙台削死书，上生字也。 其一月七步纲，自按常法，若卒急及非祸疾病，皆登时可步，不须待吉日也。 所言所祝，亦将在意，要当先祝旧文毕，及言意所愿，皆登时立效，速於水火。 女子步纲，以绛为纲象，男子步纲，以布帛为纲象。 太上隐书金简玉字，步天纲，飞地纪，升上清，入紫微之要经。 太上常使西灵神童、面有玉华者七人，侍此七星之象，於图之左右，步纲之时，神童皆从而登星也。 始学者未之见也，一年之后，常梦此七童在侧，三年之中，形见人前。 皆飞天交髻，玄黄青衣，执霞檀之膏，香华朱灯。 太上常使南真灵妃、紫灵骄女，面有金碧龙华者，侍此隐书，在书之左右，步纲之时，神女皆从而登星也。 始步者但未之见也，一年之后，常梦此七女在侧，三年之中，形见人前。 皆飞偏结，丹霞翠衣，执衣泉玄脂，日华香灯，斋洁七日，乃传此经，受者亦然。 《太上四极明科》，有书听百年得一传，其在七百年内，一人限三传而已，过数不得复出受之。 授之皆斋乃度，立盟结誓，保无泄露，试校彼心，探其厚薄，审其内实，料其善恶，然后乃出以与之耳。 若非骨命，不应得此书。 若是行尸皮好之夫，将试而不悟，生构怨雠，或见伤杀，违生失和，有及此者，皆非得道之子，当受恶以止，勿语其故。 天灵七君，道德大神，自照观荣辱，报以介福，且勿忧也。 此真极之意，后圣之法，亦足以测有为矣，亦足以知无能为矣。 子有悟其观试者，当随事首谢七星之神也，乃得补复其失也。 八禀诀曰：非求仙之难也，得其人之难也； 非学道之难也，得受其经之难也； 非受其经难也，过试而不知之难也； 非经试之难也，行经精诚之难也。 太上秘言，妙矣信矣。 太上紫书王君自序 青要紫书曰：子欲升天，当行七灵，既登北极，又入紫庭，非人勿传，先试其情。 此之谓也，正论步纲之事耳。 吾昔受神经，人有试吾者，无故以杖槌吾手而血出，吾犹倾心向之，情不他念，是试之过也。 遂得此经，见告曰：子昨已履水火中，得脱矣。 吾初时亦不解此语，晚乃悟以槌手为试也。 吾昔授一人神经，经法有试投之约，未授之前，乃无故举火烧其衣，衣尽而彼不言，然色不大惧然也。 虽尔奸丑之炁不形於外，非恶之言不发於口，故为得过也，吾后亦授其步纲隐经也。 其施行得道，上登太极，乃见先有刻太极北璧书字者云：咸阳茅盈，受步纲经，师法隐试，火烧衣形，口虽不言，色犹不平，是为下过，非真之精，可行太极，勿登上清。 盈见璧文字，读之怅然，自见试受书以来，初自不悟有色炁不平之累，于今九十八年矣，乃知鉴纲玄璧，无细不书也。 乃更克复往□，诉誓上真，始得补帝皇之卿耳。 子其勖之，王君以此言告小王君。 太上隐书玉精真诀，以致太极隐芝，翠羽华衣，紫绣毛帔，丹青飞裳，五岳灵山，六元七玄，明真地神，游行之仙，皆各献其方物，奏书太微宫。

Those who practice the Stepping of the Principles must not sleep at dusk on winter jiazi days, lest the radiance of the Seven Stars obscure their eyesight.

If sudden emergencies or misfortunes such as illness arise, one may step the Principles at once without waiting for an auspicious day. Whatever is spoken or invoked must be done with intent. First recite the established text in full, then state one’s personal wishes—both will take immediate effect, swifter than water or fire.

For women stepping the Principles, the image of the Principles is made of crimson silk; for men, it is made of cloth. The *Supreme Hidden Writ in Gold Tablets and Jade Characters* is the essential scripture for stepping the Celestial Principles, soaring through the Earthly Traces, ascending to the Supreme Clarity, and entering the Purple Tenuity.

The Supreme Lord always dispatches seven Divine Lads of the Western Numinosity, their faces adorned with jade blossoms, to attend the image of the Seven Stars. When stepping the Principles, these lads ascend the stars alongside the practitioner. Beginners do not see them at first, but after one year, they will often dream of these seven lads by their side, and within three years, their forms will appear before them. They wear flying topknots, dark-yellow and azure robes, and hold ointments of rosy clouds and incense, with vermilion lamps.

The Supreme Lord also dispatches the Southern Perfected Numinous Consort and the Purple Numinous Proud Maidens, their faces adorned with golden and azure dragon blossoms, to attend this hidden writ. When stepping the Principles, these divine maidens ascend the stars alongside the practitioner. Beginners do not see them at first, but after one year, they will often dream of these seven maidens by their side, and within three years, their forms will appear before them. They wear flying side-knots, cinnabar and azure robes, and hold black unguents from the Clothing Spring, sun-bright incense, and lamps. One must fast and purify for seven days before transmitting this scripture, and the recipient must do the same.

According to the *Supreme Four Limits of Luminous Regulations*, this scripture may be transmitted only once every hundred years. Within seven hundred years, each master may transmit it to no more than three disciples. Beyond this number, it may not be further transmitted. Transmission must be preceded by purification rites, oaths of alliance, and vows of secrecy. The master must examine the disciple’s heart, probe their depth, assess their sincerity, and weigh their goodness or wickedness before entrusting the scripture to them. If one’s bone destiny is not aligned, they will not receive this writ.

If a mere walking corpse or one with a fair exterior but corrupt nature attempts to test the scripture without awakening, they may incur enmity, suffer injury or death, or disrupt harmony in life. Such individuals are not true disciples of the Dao and will meet with misfortune to halt their progress. Do not explain the reason. The Seven Celestial Lords of Numinosity, great spirits of the Dao and virtue, observe honor and disgrace and bestow corresponding blessings—do not worry.

This is the ultimate truth and the method of later sages, sufficient to gauge those with intent and to recognize those without ability. If you perceive the trials, you must first bow and offer thanks to the spirits of the Seven Stars to rectify your errors.

The Eight Endowments Formula states:
It is not the pursuit of immortality that is difficult, but finding the right person.
It is not the study of the Dao that is difficult, but receiving its scriptures.
It is not receiving the scriptures that is difficult, but passing the trials without realizing it.
It is not the trials themselves that are difficult, but practicing the scriptures with utmost sincerity.

The Supreme Lord’s secret words are wondrous and true.

The Supreme Lord’s Purple Writ, as recorded by Perfected Lord Wang, states in the *Azure Essentials and Purple Writ*: "If you wish to ascend to Heaven, you must practice the Seven Numinosities. Having ascended the Northern Culmen, you will enter the Purple Court. Do not transmit this to the unworthy; first test their disposition." This is the proper discourse on stepping the Principles.

When I first received the divine scripture, someone tested me by striking my hand with a staff for no reason, drawing blood. I still turned my heart toward them, my thoughts unwavering—this was the trial I had to pass. I then obtained this scripture, and was told, "Yesterday, you traversed water and fire and emerged unscathed." At first, I did not understand these words, but later realized the trial was the striking of my hand.

Upon reading the inscription, Mao Ying was dismayed. Reflecting on his trial since receiving the scripture, he realized he had not perceived the flaw of his unsettled expression and qi. Ninety-eight years had passed, and he now understood that the mysterious mirror of the Celestial Principles records even the smallest details. He then redoubled his efforts, vowing to the Supreme Perfected Ones, and was finally appointed a minister of the Imperial Sovereign.

Take heed of this, for Perfected Lord Wang has imparted these words to the Lesser Perfected Lord.

The *Jade Essence Hidden Writ and True Formula* beckons the hidden mushrooms of the Supreme Ultimate, adorned with kingfisher plumes and flowered robes, purple embroidered feathered capes, and cinnabar and azure flying skirts. This system follows the subtle configurations and precise divisions of the celestial patterns, hence the necessity of binding oaths. Since golden dragons and jade fish are nonexistent in the world, one must not withhold the scripture while awaiting such rare tokens. Instead, thirty *chi* of blue cloth may serve as the standard for this oath, demonstrating its beginning and end and manifesting one’s sincerity and reverence. This offering shall be presented to the master who holds the scripture, and the master in turn must distribute it without hoarding for personal gain. Violating the covenant incurs the judgment of the Three Officials, a matter of no small consequence. The Perfected Ones esteem blue as the token of trust and gold as the symbol of sincerity; whenever oaths are sworn, these are invoked as proof.

Those who breach the statutes or leak the secrets commit grave offenses, extending punishment to their grandparents and subjecting them to the torments of hell. The objects of oaths must always be placed in the highest regard and never disclosed to others.

The *Three Charts of the Celestial Pass* state:
*"Cultivate the root with essence,
Awaken the heart with balance,
Unite the origin with sincerity—
All endeavors shall flourish.
The Perfected Ones treasure covenants,
Cherish gold and revere blue.
Harmonize with incantations,
Point to them as pledges—
This oath is mighty;
Do not violate or take it lightly."*

Each transmission of oaths is bound by numerical limits. Those who, without proper transmission, recklessly reveal the titles of scripture passages commit the offense of leakage. The Jade Lads and Jade Maidens shall report to the Most High; after three such violations, one’s name reappears in the registers of death, and immortality is forever forfeited.

All transmissions must adhere to the covenant, and the recipient must return the gold and blue cloth to the master as an encouragement of merit and virtue. The Most High’s *Jade Scripture* and hidden writings are all stored in separate cases. When practicing or consulting them, one must burn incense, with Jade Lads and Jade Maidens standing guard on either side—do not assume their absence merely because they are unseen.

The numinous mirror of the Perfected Ones, descending from the Supreme Void, scrutinizes even the most minute intentions. How could one fail to be vigilant?

In the world, there also exists the method of *Pacing the Celestial Net and Treading the Earthly Records*. During the first year of the Yangshuo era, Wang Feng, the Grand Marshal of Emperor Cheng of Han, heard that the Daoist Liu Jing had studied immortality under Zhang Jun of Handan and obtained the method of *Pacing the Celestial Net*. Feng pressured him with authority and rank, and Jing, unable to refuse, secretly compiled an abridged version to give him. Feng regarded it as the key to longevity and wealth, practicing it in utmost secrecy and transmitting it within his clan. Thus, its invocations often employed terms of wealth, rank, and emolument, utilizing the days of *Heavenly Granary* and *Heavenly Treasury* for their conjunctions.

The emergence of this abridgment began with Liu Jing. By the end of the Han, he also showed it to Huangfu Long, who likewise revered and practiced it. Yet such superficial teachings—how could they move heaven and earth or stir the divine Perfected Ones?

Wang Se, a disciple of Feng, was enfeoffed as a marquis during Wang Mang’s reign. He claimed the *Scripture of Pacing the Celestial Net* was a celestial omen, casting it onto golden tablets and presenting it to Mang. What limit could there be to the benefits of *Pacing the Celestial Net*? Yet without seeing the true original text and its essential instructions, one already gains boundless advantage—how much more so if one attains its root?

The abridged method spread widely through the world, originating with Liu Jing and persisting to this day. As for the *Great Secrets of the Most High’s Jade Scripture on Flying Records and Pacing the Earthly Net*, Jing treasured and concealed them, and none knew to whom he transmitted them.
